docs.lead_paragraph: One of our correspondents at Constantinople gives the following interesting items of information under date of April 20: The order of the Government, driving the Greeks from the country in fifteen days from the 1st of April, caused the utmost suffering among that class of the population.

docs.lead_paragraph: MYSTERIOUS.--A gentleman came on the cars from the East, and put up at the Exchange Hotel in this city, on the 13th of April last, entering his name on the register as "H. M. BATES." He was unwell when he arrived, and continued to grow worse until the 13th inst., when he died. His disease was typhoid fever. His at tending physician was Prof. ALLEN, who counseled with other able physicians in the city.

docs.lead_paragraph: Rev. WILLIAM C. SCOFIELD has been dismissed from the pastoral charge of the Second Congregational Church. in Danbury, Conn. Rev. JOSEPH. N. McGIFFERT was installed pastor of the Presbyterian Church in Hillsdale, N. Y., by the Presbytery of Columbia, May 9.

headline.main: ONE DAY LATER FROM THE ISTHMUS.; Arrival of the Illinois and Northern Light. $2,220,000 in Specie, and 1,244 Passengers. IMPORTANT FROM SAN JUAN. Greytown in Arms. HIGH-HANDED PROCEEDINGS. ARREST OF THE AMERICAN MINISTER.

docs.lead_paragraph: The papers from the steamer Illinois reached us at an early hour on Thursday morning. To Purser E. W. HULL, we are indebted for early favors. The Illinois sailed from Aspinwall 6 o'clock P. M., 17th inst., 18 hours after the sailing of the North Star, which arrived here Wednesday afternoon.

headline.main: FROM JAMAICA.; Progress of the Cholera--Political Intelligence--Miscellaneous.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cholera, that mysterious and awful scourge, still exists to an alarming extent in various parts of the country. The Central Board of Health, composed of several talented gentlemen, mostly of the Faculty, have drawn up such a notification of the nature, origin, spread.

byline.original: Correspondance of the New-York Daily Times

headline.main: ARRIVAL OF THE NORTH STAR.; From California to May 1. $450,000 Specie and 740 Passengers. COL. FREMONT'S ARRIVAL. Marine Disasters. Later from Oregon--Washington Territory--Sandwich and Society Islands--Australia--The Isthmus--Jamaica--South America, &c., &c. Later from the Mexican Insurgents.

docs.lead_paragraph: The North Star was telegraphed as off Sandy Hook yesterday in time for the bare announcement in our Evening edition. Following is her report as furnished by Purser OLEY, to whom as to Mr. BOYLE of ADAMS' Express, we are also indebted for papers at the earliest possible hour:

headline.main: CANADIAN AFFAIRS.; Meeting of the Canadian Parliament--Protestant Movements--Miscellaneous Intelligence.

byline.original: Canadian Correspondence of the New=York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: THOMAS RITCHIE Jr., one of the editors of the Richmond Enquirer, died on Sunday evening last. The Washington Sentinel, speaking of the deceased, says: " For several years he has been in feeble health, and for many months his friends have been convinced that he could not long survive.

headline.main: FOUR DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE FRANKLIN. Russian Fleet in the Baltic about to give Battle. The Odessa Affair--Further Particulars. AUSTRIA AND PRUSSIA. British Finances. LATER FROM CHINA. SERIOUS ILLNESS OF THE POPE. Markets Better Consols 88 Cotton Firm--Flour Bearer at Liverpool. THE WAR. The Czar and the German Powers. Bombardment of Odessa--Russian, German and French Accounts. The Odessa Affair. GREAT BRITAIN. The Chancellor's Trade Report. Mexico and her British Creditors. Funeral of the Marquis of Anglesey. A Musical Treat--Mario, Lablache, and Bosia. Russian Naval Force in the Baltic. FRANCE. MALTA. Position of Sweden and Denmark. Illness of the Pope. INDIA AND CHINA. Piracy in the Mediterranean. FOREIGN COMMERCIAL INTELLIGENCE. London Money Market. London Trade Report. Liverpool Corn Trade. Trade in France.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival o the United States Mail steamer Franklin, J. A. WOTTON, Esq., Commander, we have dates from London and Southampton to the 10th, and Havre the 9th inst., inclusive. The Hermann arrived off Cowes at midnight on the 6th inst. After coaling at Southampton, she proceeded to Bremen on the 8th.
